{"step_by_step_thinking": "A pseudopocket is a type of dental pocket that forms as a result of gingival enlargement without apical migration of the epithelial attachment. It is not associated with attachment loss, which is a feature of periodontitis. It is also not associated with trans-septal fibres loss. The depth of a pseudopocket can be more than 3 mm, but this is not a defining characteristic.", "answer_choice": "A"}
